notesStmt.note: Stained. Much water-damaged with occasional loss of text.

An entry of sale between the inheritants of Eliyah of Fano and Shelomoh of Parmigiani (?): folio 5r.Censored by Dominico Irosolomitano, Italian censor (active 1575-1624): inscribed with his name (folio 121v); see 61, and appendix § 62-74. Censored by Giovanni Domenico Carretto, Italian censor (active 1600-1624): inscribed with his name, 1623 (folio 38r, 55v, 87v, 109r, 121r); see 100-101, and appendix § 80-84.Censored by Alessandro Scipione, Italian censor (fl. 1575-1599): inscribed with his name, 1597 (folio 121v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 296: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, folio [122v] (fse001v).
